sv.purpose: Canadian C-spine Rule (CCR) används för att utan bruk av bilddiagnostik utesluta halsryggskador hos traumapatienter i stabilt, vaket tillstånd.
sv.use:
Exklusionskriterier som måste tas i beaktande återfinns under \"Misuse\".

Inklusionskriterier:

- Om patienten har högriskfaktor (ålder >65, något av alternativen listade under \"Farliga mekanismer\" eller  parestesier i armar eller ben) krävs bilddiagnostik.

Farlig mekanism:

Fall >= 5 trappsteg
Axialt våld mot huvudet
Trafikolycka: >100km/h, voltat, utslängd ur fordonet
Motordrivet fritidsfordon
Cykelolycka

- Om patienten saknar högriskfaktorer men även lågriskfaktorer (listade nedan), krävs bilddiagnostik.

Uppesittande på akuten
Varit uppegående efter inträffad händelse
Fördröjd smärtdebut
Ingen ömhet i nackens medellinje
Enkel påkörning bakifrån: ej inkrockad i mötande trafik, påkörd av buss eller lastbil eller voltat, samt låg hastighet.

- Om halsryggssmärta, avsaknad av högriskfaktorer och minst en lågriskfaktor, är det säkert att testa patientens förmåga till 45 graders rotation åt höger och vänster
- Om rotation är möjlig (även med viss smärta eller obehag), krävs inte vidare bilddiagnostik.
- Om rotation ej är möjlig till 45 grader i båda riktningarna, är bilddiagnostik indicerad.
sv.misuse:
Använd ej instrumentet om någon av följande exklusionskriterier föreligger:

Ej traumapatient
GCS <15
Instabila vitalparametrar
Ålder <16 år
Akut paralys
Känd vertebral sjukdom
Tidigare genomgång halsryggskirurgi

en.purpose: The Canadian C-spine Rule (CCR) helps to safely rule out CSI (Cervical spine injury) in trauma patients who are in a stable and alert condition without needing to resort to taking radiographic images.
en.use:
There are a series of exclusion criteria that have to be taken into account before using the tool which are outlined in the Misuse section.

Inclusion criteria:

- If a patient has any high risk factors (age > 65, a defined dangerous mechanism (see below) or paresthesias in the arms or legs) then they require c-spine imaging.

Dangerous mechanism:

Fall from elevation >= 3 feet/5 stairs
Axial load to head e.g. diving
MVC (motor vehicle collision) high speed (>100km/hr), rollover, ejection
Motorized recreational vehicles
Bicycle collision

- If a patient has no high risk factors but meets none of the defined low risk criteria (see list), they require c-spine imaging.

Sitting position in the ED
Ambulatory at any time
Delayed (not immediate onset) neck pain
No midline tenderness. 
Simple rear-end motor vehicle collision (MVC) not simple if: pushed into traffic, hit by bus/large truck, rollover, hit by high-speed vehicle.

- If a patient has no high risk factors, has neck pain, but meets even one low risk factor, then it is safe to assess whether the patient is able to rotate their neck 45 degrees to the left and right. 
- If they can do this (even with some pain or discomfort), then they do not require further imaging. 
- If they cannot rotate their neck 45 degrees in both directions then c-spine images are indicated.
en.misuse:
Do not use if any of the following exclusion criteria are present:

Exclusion Criteria:

Non-trauma Patients
GCS <15
Unstable Vital Signs
Age <16 Years
Acute Paralysis
Known Vertebral Disease
Previous C-Spine Surgery

other_details.references: Ref. 1: Stiell IG, Wells GA, Vandemheen KL, Clement CM, Lesiuk H, De Maio VJ, Laupacis A, Schull M, McKnight RD, Verbeek R, Brison R, Cass D, Dreyer J, Eisenhauer MA, Greenberg GH, MacPhail I, Morrison L, Reardon M, Worthington J. The Canadian C-spine rule for radiography in alert and stable trauma patients. JAMA. 2001 Oct 17;286(15):1841-8. PubMed PMID: 11597285

gt0001.description: Canadian C-spine Rule (CCR) används för att utan bruk av bilddiagnostik utesluta halsryggskador hos traumapatienter i stabilt, vaket tillstånd.

gt0003.text: Q1. Ålder ≥ 65 år, extremitetsparestesi eller farlig mekanism? (om nej - gå vidare till Q2)
gt0003.description:
Is the patient's age ≥ 65 years, are they exhibiting extremity paresthesias or subjected to a dangerous mechanism (IF no go to Q2).  Dangerous mechanism:

Fall from elevation >= 3 feet/5 stairs
Axial load to head e.g. diving
MVC (motor vehicle collision) high speed (>100km/hr), rollover, ejection
Motorized recreational vehicles
Bicycle collision

gt0004.text: Q2. Föreliggande lågriskfaktor? (om ja - gå vidare till Q3)
gt0004.description:
At least one Low risk factor including: sitting position in the ED
Ambulatory at any time
Delayed (not immediate onset) neck pain
No midline tenderness. 
Simple rear-end motor vehicle collision (MVC) not simple if: pushed into traffic, hit by bus/large truck, rollover, hit by high-speed vehicle.

gt0005.text: Q3. Aktiv rotation i 45° höger och vänster möjlig?
gt0005.description: Assess whether the patient is able to rotate their neck 45 degrees to the left and right (even with some pain or discomfort).

gt0018.description:
Management in high risk cases: If a patient has a clinically significant c-spine injury identified on imaging:
•Maintain cervical spine protection with an appropriate collar.
•Consult neurosurgery.
•Keep patient non-ambulatory and NPO until treatment plan is complete.
•Patient may require emergent operative stabilization and/or admission to Neurosurgical ICU.

gt0001.description: The Canadian C-spine Rule (CCR) helps to safely rule out CSI (Cervical spine injury) in trauma patients who are in a stable and alert condition without needing to resort to taking radiographic images.

gt0003.text: Q1. Age ≥ 65 years, extremity paresthesias or dangerous mechanism (IF no go to Q2)
gt0003.description:
Is the patient's age ≥ 65 years, are they exhibiting extremity paresthesias or subjected to a dangerous mechanism (IF no go to Q2).  Dangerous mechanism:

Fall from elevation >= 3 feet/5 stairs
Axial load to head e.g. diving
MVC (motor vehicle collision) high speed (>100km/hr), rollover, ejection
Motorized recreational vehicles
Bicycle collision

gt0004.text: Q2. Low risk factor present (if yes – low risk go to Q3)
gt0004.description:
At least one Low risk factor including: sitting position in the ED
Ambulatory at any time
Delayed (not immediate onset) neck pain
No midline tenderness. 
Simple rear-end motor vehicle collision (MVC) not simple if: pushed into traffic, hit by bus/large truck, rollover, hit by high-speed vehicle.

gt0005.text: Q3. Able to actively rotate neck 45° left and right IF NO – High risk factors
gt0005.description: Assess whether the patient is able to rotate their neck 45 degrees to the left and right (even with some pain or discomfort).

gt0018.description:
Management in high risk cases: If a patient has a clinically significant c-spine injury identified on imaging:
•Maintain cervical spine protection with an appropriate collar.
•Consult neurosurgery.
•Keep patient non-ambulatory and NPO until treatment plan is complete.
•Patient may require emergent operative stabilization and/or admission to Neurosurgical ICU.
